thread.title: Anti-Police Riots Explode After Off-Duty LAPD Officer Clashes With Teens
thread.title_full: Anti-Police Riots Explode After Off-Duty LAPD Officer Clashes With Teens

author: Dan Lyman
title: Anti-Police Riots Explode After Off-Duty LAPD Officer Clashes With Teens
text:
Anti-Police Riots Explode After Off-Duty LAPD Officer Clashes With Teens Altercation results in discharged weapon, violent protests Dan Lyman | Infowars.com - February 23, 2017 Comments 
A confrontation between an off-duty LAPD officer and Southern California teenagers ended in ugly fashion with the officer discharging his firearm, prompting anti-police protests that devolved into violence and rioting. 
The original incident took place in the officer‚Äôs Anaheim neighborhood, where it is reported that he has an on-going feud with bands of teens trespassing on his property. 
A press release from the Anaheim Police Department describes the circumstances of the altercation ‚Äì 
‚ÄúThe confrontation began over ongoing issues with juveniles walking across the officer‚Äôs property. During the confrontation, a 13 year old male is alleged to have threatened to shoot the off-duty officer, at which time the officer attempted to detain the male until APD arrived. This led to a physical confrontation between the off-duty officer and several other juveniles. During the confrontation the officer discharged his firearm one time.‚Äù 
While attempting to detain 13-year-old Christian Dorscht until police arrived on the scene, the officer was assaulted by other youths, at which time he drew his firearm, appearing to fire it into the ground. No one was struck by the round. 
In the video, the officer can be heard accusing Dorscht of threatening to ‚Äúshoot‚Äù him, while Dorscht responds that he threatened to ‚Äúsue‚Äù him, also claiming that his own father is a police officer. 
An additional video of the episode was posted to Facebook. 
Outraged protestors targeted the officers home while others took to the streets to riot and carry out violent, malicious actions against innocent civilians and businesses in the area in scenes that have become all too familiar in U.S. cities. According to police, 24 arrests were made during the chaos. #Anaheim home of off-duty #LAPD officer was vandalized after he scuffled with teens & fired a shot @CBSLA @KNX1070 pic.twitter.com/pKQ9haGIwI
